meanings.definition: To break open or apart suddenly and violently.
meanings.sent1: The balloon will brust if you blow too much air into it.
meanings.sent2: The dam brust open after heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally made the watermelon brust open when I dropped it.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room was so intense, it felt like it could brust at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The pressure inside the bottle was building up, ready to brust out.

meanings.definition: A sudden, violent outburst of emotion or action.
meanings.sent1: His brust of anger surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The child's brust of laughter filled the playground.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's playful brust of energy was contagious.
meanings.sent4: Her brust of creativity led to a beautiful piece of art.
meanings.sent5: The audience's brust of applause echoed through the theater.
